content.question: Which of the following best explains how Sartoriâ€™s idea of centripetal party systems relates to the United Kingdom?

choices.label: There is one dominant political party in the United Kingdom, which has caused the other parties to move to the political center.
There has been an increase in support for minor parties, which has pushed the major parties away from the political center.
UKIP and the Greens are popular centrist parties, which has made the major parties move toward the political center.
A large number of voters have switched parties since 2000, which has caused the major parties to move away from the political center.

content.answer: There has been an increase in support for minor parties, which has pushed the major parties away from the political center.
